definition: having a unique or distinctive style
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively

sentences.english: Or you can go for an eclectic look with a shiny metal or painted cart.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以别具一格，选择带金属光泽或色彩鲜艳的。

sentences.english: Some say the Forest Service should manage it differently.
sentences.chinese: 另一些人认为林业局应该用别具一格的方式来管理。

sentences.english: We can supply the briefly and the different unique style bending glass lamps.
sentences.chinese: 可以提供风格简约，别具一格的烤弯玻璃灯。

sentences.english: The combination of these exclusive caviars are perfect for a caviar tasting, and make an elegant gift.
sentences.chinese: 如果把这三种鱼子酱混在一起，味道更始别具一格。

sentences.english: Wuyi rock tea brewing, having a unique style.
sentences.chinese: 武夷岩茶的冲泡，别具一格。

sentences.english: These maps are usually influenced in style and setting by different regions of the world.
sentences.chinese: 这些贴图通常别具一格被分到不同的地区。

sentences.english: Since oil and water do not mix the ingredients of these tar sands formed an unusual arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 由于水和油互不溶合，这种油沙的成分别具一格。

sentences.english: I really like these Half Timber Houses at Europe.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲乡区别具一格的旧房子。

sentences.english: He writes in a very individual way.
sentences.chinese: 他的写作方法别具一格。

sentences.english: Drinking poet Li Bai's poems fully reflects the unique personality.
sentences.chinese: 李白的饮酒诗充分反映出诗人别具一格的人格力量。

sentences.english: Today, we are on the one unique, lively and interesting composition class.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我们上了一节别具一格，生动有趣的作文课。

sentences.english: His style of writing individualizes his novels.
sentences.chinese: 他的写作风格使他的小说别具一格。

sentences.english: The theme of Liu Zhi Yi's prose is of a unique stlye in American Chinese literature.
sentences.chinese: 刘子毅散文的题材在美国华文文学中别具一格。

definition: original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach
variant of 別緻|别致[bie2 zhi4]
unusual/unique
to have unique (talent, insight etc)
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
see 獨具|独具[du2 ju4]
unique/distinct/having special characteristics
a pleasant change/a breath of fresh air/refreshing
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
characteristic/distinguishing feature or quality

refined/elegant
